title: (inspira(informa))tion Age
description:
In the information war

In the information war 
Leviathan stares dumb and drooling from below
Like an aphasic child on adderal
Dazzled by screen time shadows on the wall

Above him the egregore graze and dance like the northern lights from the Suns final phase this too will come to pass
Even the abyss, though terrified wouldn’t miss a show like this. 

In the information war
The inspiration shore slick with spume 
Where sea lion and starfish sink in quick sand, a dreamers tomb. 
Desire being devoured by the land
Well if your not gunna lend it
You better give’m all a hand
Bravo 

Bravo

In the information war
Truth will be bent
Words will be stretched
And self will be immense 

Where once ghosts of greats would crawl over tongues through teeth past lips
To then become prints upon bodies unwillingly lent by copse and groves. 
Where today the ghosts are wielded like past wounds of guilt on carousel crystal balls of plastic and silica servers and coded walls. 
And the forests are degraded yet more to toilet paper where ghosts of artificial meals are smears flushed and forgotten. Essential insignificant normalization. 

Oh what rubbish we’ve sold and boughten. 

In the information war 
Unshackled slaves stare starry eyed
Amazed. Lethargic. 
Singing songs of the stupid
No life
No pain
Shallow
Bandied as beauty
Everything all things only the good must be. 
Easily achieved of truth is what you want it to be, and the false will set you free….
